channel.title: {317} client: Running on a 64-bit computer
channel.description:
The client will run, yes, but when I try to walk it will boot me off and exit out of the whole client. How do I make the client run with the (x86) program files, and not with the regular ones, so it will use 64-bit.
[code]@echo off start javaw -Xmx512M client 82 highmem exit[/code]
That's the run file right now. I've tried changing it to "C:\Program Files (X86)\Java...." but when I do it tells me -Xmx512M is unrecognized. Any way to fix it to where the client will run, and stay running?
tl;dr The client exits after I click twice on my 64 bit computer.

item.title: {317} client: Running on a 64-bit computer
item.dc:creator: @DrPepper DrPepper
item.description:
@DrPepper wrote:

Thanks for trying, but that still makes the client close after two clicks. I thought it’d be that simple also.

Read full topic

item.title: {317} client: Running on a 64-bit computer
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

Put this in “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/javaw” where it says start javaw, but do NOT get rid of -Xmx512M client 82 highmem and make sure you have the quotes in the “C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre6/bin/javaw”, don’t delete the quotes or it won’t work

Read full topic
